intro: Grewia mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte grewia, is a shrub native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its fruit is a small, spherical berry that turns red when mature. Grewia mayottensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
